Include plant-based protein sources: Plant-based protein sources, such as beans, lentils, tofu, and tempeh, are high in essential vitamins and minerals. Replacing animal-based protein sources with plant-based options can help you meet your nutritional needs.

Consume fortified foods: Many fortified foods, such as cereals, milk, and orange juice, are enriched with essential vitamins and minerals. Incorporating these foods into your diet can help you meet your daily requirements.

Increase your intake of colorful fruits and vegetables: Consuming a variety of colorful fruits and vegetables can provide you with a wide range of essential vitamins and minerals. Opt for seasonal and locally sourced produce to ensure that you are getting the best quality.

Use supplements: While it's essential to get nutrients from whole foods, supplements can be a helpful addition to your diet. Choose high-quality supplements that have been tested for purity and potency.

Practice intermittent fasting: Intermittent fasting can help you consume fewer calories and increase your nutrient intake. By eating within a specific time frame and consuming nutrient-dense foods during that time, you can ensure that you are getting all the essential vitamins and minerals.
